page.description: Mark a range of records in the table.

argument.name: Filter_Expr
argument.description: Optional. Default = ".T." (all records in current query or range). A character filter expression that specifies which records in the table should be marked.

page.discussion: The <TBL>.MARK_RANGE() method is a high-level utility function used to mark selected records in a table. The operation is performed on the records in the table pointed to by the <TBL> object pointer. If the optional Filter_Expression is omitted, records in the current query or range are marked. If a Filter is included, the current query or range is ignored, and records that satisfy the Filter Expression are marked. Note : If you are marking records in a set with one-many child links off the parent table in which you are marking records, remember that if referential integrity is enabled, marking a parent record will result in all matching child records being marked as well.

section.title: Example
section.description: This script marks California customer records.
section.example: dim tbl as P tbl = table.open("d:\a5\a_sports\customer.dbf") 'Perform a query to find California customers. query.filter = "State_prov = 'CA' " query.order = "Recno()" qry_ca_cust = tbl.query_create() 'Mark all records in current query by ommiting the optional filter expression tbl.mark_range() tbl.close()

section.description: This script ignores the current range and marks New York customers.
section.example: dim tbl as P tbl = table.open("d:\a5\a_sports\customer.dbf") 'Perform a query to find Californiacustomers. query.filter = "State_prov = 'CA' " query.order = "Recno()" qry_ca_cust = tbl.query_create() 'Mark all records in New York tbl.mark_range("State_prov = 'NY' ") tbl.close()

section.description: This script marks all of the records in a table individually without using the <TBL>.MARK_RANGE() method.
section.example: dim tbl as P tbl = table.current() tbl.fetch_first() while .NOT. tbl.fetch_EOF() tbl.change_begin() tbl.mark() tbl.change_end(.T.) tbl.fetch_next() end while
